metadata.title: Limitless
metadata.writer: Leslie Dixon (based on novel by Alan Glynn)

scenes.title: The Ledge - Opening Flash-Forward

location.description: Ultra-luxury high-rise apartment building with state-of-the-art security, multimillion-dollar terrace overlooking New York City
location.significance: Represents the heights Eddie has reached and the precariousness of his position - literally on the edge

mdtTracking.effects: Enhanced cognition but facing death

plotSummary.brief: Eddie stands on his penthouse ledge as armed killers breach his door
plotSummary.detailed: Professional killers use power tools to breach Eddie's state-of-the-art security door. Security guards lie dead in the lobby. Eddie Morgan, transformed and stylish, stands on the exterior ledge of his 80-story penthouse, ready to jump. He reflects on becoming the perfect version of himself.
plotSummary.subtext: Establishes the central question: how did someone go from nothing to everything, and what price did they pay?

keyDialogue.quote: How many of us ever know what it is to become the perfect version of ourselves?
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Central thematic question about human potential and cost of perfection

scenes.significance: Cold open that creates narrative hook and establishes stakes

eddie.state: Transformed Eddie at peak crisis - stylish, lean, enhanced but cornered on penthouse ledge
eddie.transformation: End result shown first: complete physical and cognitive transformation, but facing death
eddie.psychologicalState: Fatalistic acceptance mixed with bitter regret; calm facing death but mourning the waste of potential; philosophical about becoming 'the perfect version' of himself

otherCharacters.name: Professional Killers
otherCharacters.role: Unseen antagonists breaching Eddie's security door with power tools
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Eddie's mortal enemies - sophisticated, organized, deadly. Evolved to match his enhanced intelligence
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Represent ultimate consequence of Eddie's NZT journey - people willing to kill him for the drug or to silence him

otherCharacters.name: Neighbor
otherCharacters.role: Collateral damage - middle-aged man who complains about noise
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Unknown neighbor who dies simply for opening his door
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Shows how Eddie's choices create innocent casualties; buys Eddie 'half a minute' with his death

scenes.title: Schlumpy Eddie - Rock Bottom

location.primary: Eddie's Ratty Rent-Controlled Apartment on Avenue A
location.description: Fourth-floor walk-up tenement, disheveled, cluttered with unpaid bills, sink full of dishes
location.significance: Physical manifestation of Eddie's mental state - chaotic, unproductive, stuck

time.narrative: Two years after losing copywriting job

mdtTracking.effects: No MDT - struggling writer at rock bottom

plotSummary.brief: Flashback reveals Eddie as a failed writer, overweight, unmotivated, playing games instead of writing
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie Morgan in his 'before' state: longer hair, out of shape, wearing worn corduroy jacket. He wastes days playing computer Scrabble, watching TV, sleeping until noon. He has a book contract but hasn't written a single word.
plotSummary.subtext: The trap of unrealized potential - having enough talent to get a contract but not enough discipline to execute

keyDialogue.quote: I was a writer. Now, at last, I was ready to write. Gearing up, that's all. Getting psyched.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Ironic self-awareness of his own procrastination and self-deception
keyDialogue.context: Voice-over while showing him doing everything except writing

scenes.significance: Establishes the 'before' state that makes transformation dramatic and drug tempting

eddie.state: Rock bottom Eddie - overweight, unmotivated, schlumpy, procrastinating writer with book contract but zero pages written
eddie.transformation: The 'before' state - establishing baseline that makes his later transformation so dramatic
eddie.psychologicalState: Self-aware about procrastination but trapped in it; ironic self-distance ('gearing up, that's all'); low self-esteem masked by cynicism; missed on-ramp at age 35

scenes.title: Lindy Breaks Up With Him

location.description: Generic Manhattan coffee shop, neutral territory for a breakup
location.significance: Public space for private devastation

mdtTracking.effects: No MDT - life falling apart, girlfriend leaving

plotSummary.brief: Lindy returns Eddie's key, ending their relationship because she can't watch him self-destruct
plotSummary.detailed: Lindy, dressed professionally and recently promoted, slides Eddie's key across the table. She's sad but resolute - she knows where Eddie's trajectory leads. She reveals awareness that Eddie still pines for ex-wife Melissa. Lindy pays for coffee Eddie can't afford.
plotSummary.subtext: Lindy represents the last person who believed in Eddie. Her leaving is self-preservation, not cruelty.

keyDialogue.quote: If I didn't care, maybe I'd be able to stand to watch you do this.
keyDialogue.speaker: Lindy
keyDialogue.significance: Love makes witnessing self-destruction unbearable
keyDialogue.context: Explaining why she has to leave

keyDialogue.quote: I really thought I had it in me to do something. And now, I don't think it is. There. Anything. At all.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Rare moment of complete honesty - the void at his core

scenes.significance: This loss creates the desperation that makes Eddie vulnerable to Vernon's offer

eddie.state: Devastated by breakup but initially trying to manipulate sympathy; finally drops defenses for rare honesty
eddie.transformation: Hits absolute bottom - losing last person who believed in him creates desperation that makes him vulnerable to NZT
eddie.psychologicalState: Desperate, hurt, finally honest: 'I don't think it is. There. Anything. At all.' - admits to internal void; still pining for ex-wife Melissa

otherCharacters.name: Lindy
otherCharacters.role: Girlfriend breaking up with Eddie out of self-preservation and love
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Loves Eddie but can't watch him self-destruct; sees through manipulation attempts; recently promoted, moving up while he crashes down; knows he still wants Melissa
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Establishes her as loving but realistic, responsible adult Eddie isn't; 'If I didn't care, maybe I'd be able to stand to watch you do this'

scenes.title: Vernon Gant - The Dealer

location.description: Manhattan bar, anonymous meeting place
location.significance: Where deals are made, where the devil appears

mdtTracking.effects: None yet

plotSummary.brief: Eddie encounters his ex-brother-in-law Vernon, now mysteriously wealthy, who offers him a drink
plotSummary.detailed: Vernon Gant, Eddie's ex-wife Melissa's brother and former drug dealer, appears looking prosperous in expensive suit. They have a drink where Vernon probes about Eddie's book. Vernon receives agitated phone call and must leave, placing his business card and mysterious white pill on the bar.
plotSummary.subtext: Vernon's transformation from dealer to wealthy businessman mirrors what Eddie could become

keyDialogue.quote: Still dealing, Vernon?
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's suspicion about Vernon's wealth source

keyDialogue.quote: Not one fucking word, Vern.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Brutal honesty about his complete failure as a writer
keyDialogue.context: Asked how much he's written of his book

scenes.significance: Introduction of the drug and the tempter - Vernon is both proof of concept and warning

eddie.state: Self-conscious about weight gain and failures; defensive but has enough pride to be annoyed by Vernon's jabs
eddie.transformation: At absolute lowest point, making him maximally vulnerable to Vernon's pharmaceutical temptation
eddie.psychologicalState: Brutally honest when pushed: 'Not one fucking word, Vern' - rare glimpse behind defenses; feels physical decay matching mental stagnation

otherCharacters.name: Vernon Gant
otherCharacters.role: Ex-brother-in-law, former drug dealer, now mysteriously wealthy - the tempter/devil figure
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Condescending amusement toward Eddie; comments on weight gain; knows Eddie's failures through Melissa; serves as proof-of-concept for NZT success
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Introduction as someone transformed by NZT - expensive suit, confidence, wealth contrasting with former dealer status; receives threatening call hinting at danger ahead

scenes.title: First Dose - MDT-48 Transformation

location.description: Victorian molding disfigured by paint, worn tile stairs, landlady's apartment
location.significance: Threshold location where transformation begins

mdtTracking.effects: First experience - immediate cognitive enhancement, clarity, focus

plotSummary.brief: Eddie swallows Vernon's pill and experiences total transformation
plotSummary.detailed: After smoker's cough, Eddie impulsively swallows the pill. Within minutes, reality transforms. His pupils contract, perception sharpens. He helps nasty landlady Valerie with her photography paper using perfectly recalled obscure knowledge. They have sex for hours. He cleans his entire apartment and writes 90 pages overnight.
plotSummary.subtext: The drug's seduction - it doesn't make Eddie someone else, it makes him the best version of himself

keyDialogue.quote: Levels more, layers more, 3-D more... galactically more. But the same. Just the depth and beauty of clarity.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: The drug doesn't distort reality but reveals it

scenes.significance: The seduction scene - shows why the drug is irresistible despite obvious dangers

eddie.state: Undergoes radical transformation from baseline to enhanced within minutes after impulsively swallowing pill
eddie.transformation: The seduction moment - NZT doesn't make him someone else, it makes him the BEST version of himself; pupils contract, perception sharpens dramatically
eddie.psychologicalState: Experiences 'levels more, layers more, 3-D more...galactically more' clarity; accesses perfect recall of forgotten memories; feels depth and beauty of true perception for first time

otherCharacters.name: Valerie (Landlady)
otherCharacters.role: Nasty young landlady demanding rent who becomes Eddie's first conquest on NZT
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Usually hostile and contemptuous toward Eddie; completely disarmed when Eddie demonstrates enhanced knowledge about Dorothea Lange photography, helps with her paper
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Vehicle showing Eddie's transformation - he can charm anyone, recall obscure knowledge, help with academic work, have sex for hours; 'She didn't have a chance'

scenes.title: Vernon's Apartment - Getting the Supply

location.description: Expensive but messy apartment, signs of wealth and chaos
location.significance: First glimpse of drug dealer lifestyle and danger

mdtTracking.effects: Crash - exhaustion, depression, desperate need for more

plotSummary.brief: Eddie crashes hard and desperately seeks Vernon to get more pills
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie experiences brutal crash - exhaustion, depression, tremors. He goes to Vernon's address seeking more pills. Vernon's apartment is expensive but chaotic. Vernon is impressed Eddie finished 90 pages and gives him a baggie of pills. Vernon warns about side effects and tells Eddie to 'taper off.' Vernon receives threatening phone call.
plotSummary.subtext: First hint of addiction and danger - Vernon is being hunted by someone, and Eddie is entering that world

keyDialogue.quote: When it wears off, you crash. But you know that already, don't you?
keyDialogue.speaker: Vernon
keyDialogue.significance: Acknowledgment of addiction cycle

scenes.significance: Establishes addiction pattern and introduces threat that will drive plot

eddie.state: Experiencing brutal crash after first dose - exhaustion, depression, tremors, desperate need for more pills
eddie.transformation: First experience of addiction cycle - the crash reveals the drug's true hook and dependency mechanism
eddie.psychologicalState: Desperation overrides all other concerns; already psychologically and physically dependent after single dose; will do anything for more

otherCharacters.name: Vernon Gant
otherCharacters.role: Supplier and cautionary tale about NZT dangers
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Impressed Eddie wrote 90 pages overnight; warns about side effects and crash but still gives him supply; tells Eddie to 'taper off' while enabling continuation
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Shows Vernon is beaten up and in danger (threatening phone call about meeting someone); Eddie entering dangerous underworld; gives Eddie baggie of ~100 pills

scenes.title: Eddie's Transformation Montage

location.description: Bookstores, libraries, streets, gym, tailor, hair salon
location.significance: Physical journey of transformation

mdtTracking.effects: Sustained enhancement, learning multiple languages, mastering skills

plotSummary.brief: Montage of Eddie transforming physically and intellectually
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie on MDT learns Italian, Spanish, and Mandarin fluently. He absorbs entire libraries, learns piano, masters martial arts, gets in shape at the gym, buys tailored clothes, gets stylish haircut. He completes his book manuscript. He becomes the perfect version of himself.
plotSummary.subtext: The fulfillment of human potential - or the illusion of it. Eddie is becoming who he always thought he could be.

keyDialogue.quote: I wasn't learning. I was remembering. Everything I'd ever read, heard, or seen was suddenly available.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: The drug unlocks rather than creates

scenes.significance: Shows the heights of enhancement and why Eddie will never want to give it up

eddie.state: On sustained NZT regimen, transforming physically and intellectually over two weeks - learning languages, getting fit, buying new clothes
eddie.transformation: The montage of becoming: learns Italian, Spanish, Mandarin; absorbs libraries; learns piano; masters martial arts concepts; gets in shape; upgrades appearance
eddie.psychologicalState: 'I wasn't learning. I was remembering' - realizes NZT unlocks rather than creates; experiences fulfillment of human potential; becomes who he always thought he could be

scenes.title: Delivering the Manuscript

location.description: Manhattan publishing house, corporate offices
location.significance: First test of Eddie's transformation in professional world

mdtTracking.effects: Full cognitive enhancement

plotSummary.brief: Eddie delivers his completed manuscript to his stunned publisher
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie, transformed physically and stylishly dressed, delivers his finished manuscript. His publisher Mark is shocked - both by Eddie's appearance and the quality/speed of the work. Mark reads excerpts and is genuinely impressed. Eddie is confident and articulate, a stark contrast to his former self.
plotSummary.subtext: First external validation that the transformation is real and recognized by others

keyDialogue.quote: Jesus, Eddie. What happened to you?
keyDialogue.speaker: Mark (Publisher)
keyDialogue.significance: External recognition of dramatic change

scenes.significance: Validates Eddie's transformation and sets up his confidence for bigger risks

eddie.state: Confident, transformed Eddie delivering completed manuscript - physically stylish, intellectually sharp, stark contrast to former self
eddie.transformation: First external validation that transformation is real and recognized by others; emboldened to take bigger risks
eddie.psychologicalState: Confident and articulate; feels vindicated; realizes he can achieve anything on NZT; ready to expand beyond just writing

otherCharacters.name: Mark Sutton (Publisher)
otherCharacters.role: Eddie's skeptical publisher, shocked by transformation and manuscript quality
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Goes from sarcastic disbelief to genuine impressed shock; 'Jesus, Eddie. What happened to you?' - external mirror of Eddie's dramatic change
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Validates Eddie's transformation is objective, not just subjective; reads manuscript and is genuinely impressed by quality

scenes.title: Vernon's Murder

location.description: Crime scene - ransacked, bloody, chaotic
location.significance: The danger becomes real and personal

mdtTracking.effects: Hyper-alertness to danger

plotSummary.brief: Eddie finds Vernon brutally murdered, apartment ransacked for MDT pills
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie goes to return loan to Vernon and finds the door ajar. Inside, Vernon lies dead in a pool of blood, beaten and tortured. The apartment is ransacked - someone was searching for something. Eddie realizes they were after the pills. He hears noises and hides. He finds Vernon's hidden stash in the oven - a large supply of MDT. He escapes with the drugs.
plotSummary.subtext: The cost becomes clear - this isn't just about enhancement, it's about survival. People kill for MDT.

keyDialogue.quote: Someone wanted what Vernon had. And now they know about me.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Realization that he's entered a deadly game

scenes.significance: Turns the story from enhancement drama to thriller - introduces mortal stakes

eddie.state: On NZT but shocked and terrified discovering Vernon murdered - first confrontation with real mortal danger
eddie.transformation: Turns from enhancement story to survival thriller; realizes people kill for NZT; must navigate deadly landscape
eddie.psychologicalState: Terror mixed with opportunism - steals Vernon's hidden stash (500 pills, $20K cash, address book) while Vernon's body still warm; enhanced cognition helps him find hidden stash and escape

otherCharacters.name: Vernon Gant
otherCharacters.role: Murder victim - beaten, tortured, shot in forehead; apartment ransacked
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Vernon's death serves as warning Eddie doesn't fully heed; his hidden stash becomes Eddie's lifeline
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Death establishes mortal stakes; whoever killed Vernon was searching for NZT pills; Vernon left clues in his untouched stove

scenes.title: The Blonde Man Follows

location.description: Manhattan streets, subway, Eddie's neighborhood
location.significance: Paranoia and surveillance begin

mdtTracking.effects: Hyper-awareness, pattern recognition, paranoia heightened

plotSummary.brief: Eddie realizes a mysterious blonde man is following him from Vernon's apartment
plotSummary.detailed: Leaving Vernon's building with hidden MDT stash, Eddie spots a large blonde man watching him. Using enhanced perception, Eddie notices the man following him through the streets. Eddie evades through crowds and subway. The blonde man is professional, patient, dangerous. Eddie realizes Vernon's killers now know about him.
plotSummary.subtext: Enhanced cognition makes Eddie aware of threats but also amplifies paranoia - is awareness a gift or curse?

keyDialogue.quote: On MDT, you see everything. Including the man who wants to kill you.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Double-edged nature of enhancement

scenes.significance: Introduces main antagonist and establishes ongoing threat throughout film

eddie.state: Paranoid but hyper-aware on NZT - spots and evades mysterious blonde man following him from Vernon's building
eddie.transformation: Enhanced perception becomes double-edged sword - sees everything including threats, amplifying paranoia
eddie.psychologicalState: 'On NZT, you see everything. Including the man who wants to kill you.' - awareness as curse and gift; realizes he's now hunted

otherCharacters.name: The Blonde Man
otherCharacters.role: Large, professional stalker/killer following Eddie
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Patient, professional, dangerous predator hunting Eddie; knows about Eddie's connection to Vernon and NZT
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Introduction of primary physical antagonist who will pursue Eddie throughout film; represents constant mortal threat

scenes.title: Reconnecting with Lindy

location.description: Trendy restaurant, romantic setting
location.significance: Eddie attempts to reclaim his old life with his new self

mdtTracking.effects: Full enhancement - charismatic, perceptive, charming

plotSummary.brief: Eddie takes Lindy to dinner to show her his transformation
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie, stylishly dressed and confident, meets Lindy at expensive restaurant. She's shocked by his transformation. He's charming, funny, insightful - everything she wanted him to be. He reads people at nearby tables, demonstrates his new abilities. Lindy is attracted but suspicious. Eddie doesn't mention MDT, claiming it's just 'focus.' They reconnect romantically.
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie wants validation that his transformation makes him worthy of love - but it's based on a lie

keyDialogue.quote: What happened to you?
keyDialogue.speaker: Lindy
keyDialogue.significance: Everyone's question - Eddie's transformation is impossible to miss
keyDialogue.context: Seeing the new Eddie for first time

keyDialogue.quote: I just got focused. You were right about everything.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's lie of omission - not telling her about MDT

scenes.significance: Re-establishes romantic relationship while planting seeds of deception that will cause problems

eddie.state: Flush with Vernon's cash and NZT supply, transforming lifestyle and appearance completely - new clothes, haircut, fitness routine
eddie.transformation: Uses ill-gotten gains to complete physical transformation; becomes commanding presence; completes book in four days
eddie.psychologicalState: 'A tablet a day kept the torpor away. And what I could do with my day...was limitless.' - feels invincible; believes he can master anything

scenes.title: Borrowing from the Loan Shark

location.description: Eddie meets Gennady, a sinister Russian loan shark, to negotiate dangerous loan
location.significance: Eddie enters criminal world to fuel his ambitions

mdtTracking.effects: Confidence bordering on recklessness

plotSummary.brief: Eddie borrows $100,000 from Russian mobster Gennady to fund stock trading
plotSummary.detailed: After making small gains ($4,000, then $7,500), Eddie realizes he needs more capital. He confidently meets Gennady, a loan shark, at a coffee shop. Gennady is initially hostile ('I don't see you before. And I don't fucking like you already'). Eddie claims he has a stock market 'fix'. Gennady thinks Eddie is a crook, which Eddie doesn't deny. At Washington Square Park, Gennady hands Eddie $100,000 in a paper bag, warning him graphically about consequences of default: 'We cut you around the waist, peel your skin, pull it up over your head and tie knot in it.'
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie's growing hubris - MDT makes him feel invincible, leading to increasingly risky choices with dangerous people

keyDialogue.quote: I don't see you before. And I don't fucking like you already. Why do I give you 100 thousand dollars?
keyDialogue.speaker: Gennady
keyDialogue.significance: Establishes Gennady as dangerous and unpredictable

keyDialogue.quote: Okay, you take this... you mine. You don't pay, you know what we do? We cut you around the waist, peel your skin, pull it up over your head and tie knot in it.
keyDialogue.speaker: Gennady
keyDialogue.significance: Graphic threat that Eddie dismisses due to MDT confidence
keyDialogue.context: Handing over the money in Washington Square Park

scenes.significance: Introduces Gennady who becomes critical antagonist; shows Eddie's growing recklessness and entry into criminal world

eddie.state: Overconfident and reckless, entering criminal world without fear due to MDT-induced sense of invincibility
eddie.transformation: Crosses line from struggling writer to someone willing to borrow from violent criminals; MDT makes dangerous choices feel rational
eddie.psychologicalState: Fearless bordering on delusional; dismisses graphic threats of torture as irrelevant; believes MDT makes him untouchable

otherCharacters.name: Gennady
otherCharacters.role: Russian loan shark and future antagonist
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Initially hostile and suspicious, grudgingly respects Eddie's boldness and implied criminality; thinks Eddie has a stock market scam
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: First appearance - establishes him as dangerous, violent, but oddly charmed by Eddie's confidence; 'Okay, you take this... you mine.'

scenes.title: Stock Market Mastery - Lafayette Day Trading

location.description: Cubicle farm of day traders, Eddie at computer terminal surrounded by awed observers
location.significance: Eddie's leap into high finance - the drug unlocks financial genius

mdtTracking.pillsTaken: Upping the dose - now taking TWO tablets
mdtTracking.effects: Enhanced pattern recognition, probability calculation, rapid comprehension of complex financial data

plotSummary.brief: Using Gennady's $100K and leverage at Lafayette Trading, Eddie turns it into over $1 million in one week
plotSummary.detailed: Kevin Doyle shows Eddie how to leverage 2.5x his cash at a day-trading firm. Eddie takes TWO MDT tablets, doubling his dose to 'cut his learning curve.' Using enhanced pattern recognition, Eddie analyzes stock movements with superhuman speed and accuracy. Traders gather behind him, watching in awe as he predicts market moves perfectly. When asked why he's buying a stock whose CEO just got indicted, Eddie reveals he knows about an upcoming defense contract announcement. By week's end, his brokerage account contains over $1 million. The stock market becomes 'a collective nervous system' he can read perfectly.
plotSummary.subtext: MDT doesn't just enhance cognition - it makes Eddie a financial god who can see patterns invisible to others. But he's upping his dose, suggesting tolerance building.

keyDialogue.quote: My new friend, Kevin Doyle, showed me how you could leverage two and a half times your cash at a day-trading firm...
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie enters legitimate financial world through day trading

keyDialogue.quote: I'd been upping the dose for over a week. It seemed to cut my learning curve.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: First sign of dose escalation and potential addiction

keyDialogue.quote: But not for the big fat defense contract he bribed his way into. That's still on. Should be announced in a week.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Shows depth of Eddie's enhanced knowledge - he knows secret information
keyDialogue.context: Explaining why he's buying stock of indicted CEO

keyDialogue.quote: At the end of the week my brokerage account contained... over a million dollars.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's transformation from broke writer to millionaire in days

scenes.significance: Eddie's financial breakthrough that will attract Carl Van Loon; first sign of dose escalation

eddie.state: Financial savant at Lafayette Trading, awed traders gathering to watch him work; doubling MDT dose for enhanced performance
eddie.transformation: From broke writer to millionaire day trader in one week; becomes the center of attention among professional traders who can't understand his success
eddie.psychologicalState: Exhilarated by success; casually upping drug dose without considering consequences; views stock market as 'collective nervous system' he can read perfectly; growing sense of godlike power

otherCharacters.name: Kevin Doyle
otherCharacters.role: Day trader who introduces Eddie to Lafayette Trading and leveraging techniques
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Initially Eddie's guide into day trading world; quickly becomes impressed observer of Eddie's superhuman abilities
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Represents Eddie's entry into legitimate financial world; connection that will later bring Van Loon's attention

otherCharacters.name: Other Traders at Lafayette
otherCharacters.role: Professional day traders who gather behind Eddie to watch him work
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Start skeptical, become awed; one questions Eddie's stock pick, Eddie reveals insider-level knowledge that shocks them
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Their growing crowd around Eddie's terminal shows his emerging legend in finance; 'How did Eddie know that?'

scenes.title: Reconnecting with Lindy - Van Loon's Interest

location.description: Upscale Manhattan restaurant, intimate setting, white tablecloths
location.significance: Eddie proves his transformation is real; Lindy sees he's changed

mdtTracking.effects: Social brilliance, multilingual fluency, confident charm

plotSummary.brief: Eddie takes Lindy to dinner; she reveals Carl Van Loon wants to meet him; they reconcile
plotSummary.detailed: Kevin Doyle calls Eddie to share that Carl Van Loon, powerful billionaire banker, wants to meet him after hearing about his trading success. Eddie invites Lindy to fancy Italian restaurant. She's stunned by his transformation - lean, stylish, confident. He speaks fluent Italian to the hostess. Lindy reveals Van Loon's interest. She's both proud and intimidated by new Eddie. They reconcile romantically.
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie proves to Lindy (and himself) that the transformation is real and sustainable; his success attracts both romance and power

keyDialogue.quote: Carl Van Loon wants to meet you?
keyDialogue.speaker: Lindy
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's success has reached the highest levels of finance
keyDialogue.context: Lindy incredulous that Eddie is being scouted by billionaire banker

keyDialogue.quote: Since when do you speak... what happened to you?
keyDialogue.speaker: Lindy
keyDialogue.significance: Lindy recognizes Eddie is fundamentally transformed
keyDialogue.context: After Eddie speaks fluent Italian to restaurant hostess

keyDialogue.quote: Self-improvement month. Someone gave me a wake-up call.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's ironic understatement about his NZT transformation
keyDialogue.context: Explaining his dramatic change to Lindy

scenes.significance: Eddie wins back Lindy; receives invitation from Van Loon; transformation validated by personal and professional success

eddie.state: Transformed Eddie impressing Lindy with style, confidence, Italian fluency, financial success; proud but keeping NZT secret
eddie.transformation: From schlumpy failure to sophisticated success; proves transformation to ex-girlfriend who dumped him; ironic about change ('self-improvement month')
eddie.psychologicalState: Confident, charming, enjoying validation; pleased to win Lindy back; excited about Van Loon opportunity but careful not to reveal drug source

otherCharacters.name: Lindy
otherCharacters.role: Ex-girlfriend seeing Eddie's transformation for first time since breakup
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Initially confused and suspicious; becomes proud but intimidated; 'I'm actually... more than proud. I'm a little... intimidated'; attracted to new Eddie but also apprehensive
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Reversal - from leaving Eddie to being impressed and intimidated; agrees to start relationship again; 'Of course, we started up again'

otherCharacters.name: Kevin Doyle
otherCharacters.role: Eddie's day-trading contact who connects him to Van Loon
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Excited phone call about Van Loon's interest; represents Eddie's entry to big leagues
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Brief but crucial - bridges Eddie from small-time trading to Wall Street power

scenes.title: Meeting Carl Van Loon

location.description: High-end Manhattan restaurant, power dining venue
location.significance: Where deals are made at the highest level; Eddie's entry to world stage

mdtTracking.pillsTaken: Daily maintenance, but hasn't eaten in 3 days
mdtTracking.effects: Brilliant but physically strained; sweating, pale; compensating with sheer mental power

plotSummary.brief: Eddie meets billionaire Carl Van Loon and dazzles him with insights about mass psychology and markets
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie sits with Kevin Doyle, wolfing appetizers - hasn't eaten in 3 days. Kevin briefs him nervously about Van Loon being mercurial. Carl Van Loon arrives with his associate Pierce. Eddie tells Van Loon his secret is 'special medication' (truth disguised as joke). Eddie delivers brilliant speech about pattern recognition, mass psychology, decentralized decision-making. Pierce is contemptuous but Eddie counters: 'I don't have delusions of grandeur. I have an actual recipe for grandeur.' Van Loon offers Eddie a ride in his limo - first real acknowledgment.
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie's crossing from small-time trading to global power; but physical toll is showing

keyDialogue.quote: What's your secret?
keyDialogue.speaker: Van Loon
keyDialogue.significance: The central question - how does Eddie do it?

keyDialogue.quote: Medication. I'm on special medication.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie tells the truth but disguises it as joke

keyDialogue.quote: It's not understanding how companies work. It's understanding how mass psychology works.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's key insight that impresses Van Loon

keyDialogue.quote: I don't have delusions of grandeur. I have an actual recipe for grandeur.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's bold claim that seals Van Loon's interest

scenes.significance: Act 1/Act 2 transition - Eddie enters the big leagues; Van Loon becomes mentor/antagonist

eddie.state: Physically deteriorating (hasn't eaten in 3 days, sweating, pale) but intellectually brilliant; hiding physical symptoms while dazzling Van Loon
eddie.transformation: From day trader to potential Wall Street player; NZT side effects emerging but Eddie compensates with sheer mental power

Van Loon, impressed by Eddie's audacity and insight, invites him to his office the next day at 10am.

Eddie hides his sticker shock, maintains composure. He returns to his hotel room to find it completely ripped apart - just like his old apartment was. Eddie now carries the pills with him at all times. In Washington Square Park, Eddie meets Gennady to pay him back. Both men now have security teams. It's immediately obvious Gennady is on MDT - elegant movements, refined, intelligent eyes. Gennady demands 20 pills next week. Eddie refuses: 'You can fuck yourself. Not that you'll feel anything.' Gennady's security guys reach for weapons, so do Eddie's. Standoff. Gennady threatens to expose Eddie's police troubles to his 'Forbes 400 financial friends.'

plotSummary.detailed: Van Loon's team waits in conference room at 9:40am for Hank Atwood to sign the merger papers - he's a no-show. Eddie reassures Van Loon it's still on: 'I saw his eyes: it's on.' Pierce challenges Eddie's authority. Mrs. Atwood arrives instead, explaining her husband experienced pain and dizziness, is undergoing tests at Lenox Hill hospital. She assures them the merger will proceed when he's able. Eddie and Van Loon walk her to her car with platitudes. As she gets in, Eddie sees her driver: Tan Coat (the blonde man following Eddie), now with a huge angry scar across his cheek. Steely moment of recognition between them. Eddie realizes in voiceover: 'Atwood wouldn't get better. Because Atwood was out of MDT.' Eddie now knows his stalker works for Atwood, another MDT user who's run out of pills and is dying.
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie is not alone - others have discovered MDT. The 'blonde man' mystery is Atwood's search for more supply. Eddie glimpses his own potential future: run out of pills, get sick, die.

plotSummary.brief: Eddie experiences his first blackout - 8 hours of fragmented consciousness, wakes on Brooklyn Bridge with a limp and no memory
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie's consciousness begins skipping through time in jarring cuts. Flash: dancing with a beautiful black woman. Flash: having sex with her in a club bathroom stall. Flash: punching her boyfriend outside a Harlem bar, blood pouring from the man's nose, Eddie's fist hurting. Flash: sitting with middle-aged international types at an artist's loft, some speaking Italian. Flash: walking hotel corridor with an attractive Latin woman. Images speed up: wine cork popping, mussels in wine sauce, rumpled sheets, blur of bodies, swirl of color. Cab stopping, gargoyle on building, dog leash in puddle. Then blackness. Eddie comes to on the Brooklyn Bridge at dawn with a painful limp. Can't account for the last 8 hours. Nothing to do but limp back to Manhattan. Sleeps in his clothes for the first time in two days. The 'time-skips' have him scared.
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie is not in control - his enhanced brain continues making decisions but his conscious self blacks out. He's becoming a passenger in his own life.

plotSummary.brief: Off MDT, Eddie meets Van Loon poorly, sees Italian woman from blackout murdered on TV, calls Vernon's clients (3 dead, rest sick), chased by Tan Coat, meets transformed Melissa who reveals MDT kills people
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie wakes terrified of time-skips, first morning off MDT in a month. Headache curling around his head. Van Loon's files look like 'fucking hieroglyphs' without MDT. Meets Van Loon at Regency Hotel struggling to perform. During meeting, sees news on TV: the Italian woman from his blackout found dead, witness saw man with limp leaving scene. Eddie vomits outside, terrified he killed her. Melissa calls, he begs her to meet him. Eddie finds Vernon's black book, calls his other clients from Washington Square Park: Paul Kaplan dead 3 days ago, Jerry Brady in hospital with headaches. 'Of all the people I called, three were dead, and the rest were sick.' Last number in book rings - it's Tan Coat sitting nearby. Mutual recognition. Chase through streets, Eddie still limping, nearly hit by truck. Tan Coat loses him in subway. Eddie meets Melissa at Charlie's - she's shockingly transformed: thick-waisted, puffy face, blotchy pallor. She took only 9-10 MDT pills, got scared, stopped. Got violently sick with headaches. Vernon told her people were dying - one guy is vegetable being sponge-bathed by his mother. She asks how much Eddie's taken. 'A lot.'
plotSummary.subtext: Eddie faces two nightmares: he might be a murderer, and MDT is a death sentence. Melissa is his future - deteriorated, sick, damaged by the drug.

plotSummary.detailed: Eddie collapses on Lindy's office floor, barely able to breathe. Lindy realizes he's on drugs - 'all this energy, all this focus... has been some drug?' Eddie's landlady Valerie calls - someone is tearing up his apartment (Tan Coat searching for MDT). Eddie reveals he hid his stash in Lindy's apartment. Furious ('you asshole... in my fucking HOUSE?!'), Lindy retrieves the packet from inside her end table. As she leaves, a watcher calls Tan Coat. In the cab, Lindy realizes she's being followed. Tan Coat pursues her on foot through Central Park. She finds a cop on horseback for help - Tan Coat stabs the cop, who topples from his horse. Lindy hides behind rocks near the ice skating rink. On the phone with Eddie, terrified, Eddie tells her to take one of the pills: 'You will know what to do.' Lindy swallows it. Within 30 seconds, her eyes change - steely, determined. She bolts to the ice rink, Tan Coat chasing. On the ice, Lindy grabs a 6-year-old girl and swings her ice skates at Tan Coat's face like a weapon.
plotSummary.subtext: Lindy crosses the threshold - becomes an MDT user to survive. Eddie's world has now contaminated her completely.

scenes.title: Aftermath - Hotel Refuge and Lindy's Decision

location.primary: Lindy's Office / W Hotel Lobby / W Hotel Room
location.description: Lindy returns with MDT, Eddie recovers, they check into hotel to hide and plan
location.significance: Safe haven where Lindy and Eddie confront what MDT means for their relationship

mdtTracking.pillsTaken: Eddie: 1 (recovering); Lindy: experiencing effects from first dose
mdtTracking.effects: Eddie restored to sharp self; Lindy understanding MDT's full seduction

plotSummary.brief: Lindy returns after cutting Tan Coat's face with ice skates, gives Eddie MDT to recover, they check into W Hotel, Lindy reveals she understands MDT's power and danger
plotSummary.detailed: After escaping Tan Coat at the ice rink, Lindy returns to her office. She gives Eddie an MDT pill - he swallows it. They share a look of understanding, both now MDT users. Eddie quickly recovers to his sharp self. They check into the W Hotel to hide. In the hotel room, Eddie promises they'll be 'powered up' and can think their way out. He promises to share everything with her and love her. But Lindy has changed - steely, matter-of-fact. She tells Eddie he was always smart enough to do a third of these things without drugs, and 'a third would be plenty' for most people. She understands MDT's seduction now - 'invincibility in a bottle' - and knows she'll think about taking it every day for the rest of her life. But she also sees the trap: once you can see everything mapped out perfectly and always be right, who would want to wing it? The conversation reveals the fundamental divide between them.

keyDialogue.quote: I don't know who I am anymore. On or off the pill.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Identity crisis at the heart of the story

scenes.significance: Lindy's transformation and decision - she's experienced MDT's power firsthand but recognizes it as a trap. Shows what separates Lindy from Eddie: she can walk away.

eddie.state: Recovered on MDT, believing he and Lindy can be partners in this enhanced world
eddie.transformation: Misreads the situation - thinks Lindy taking MDT brings them together when it's actually pushing them apart
eddie.psychologicalState: Optimistic about shared future, doesn't understand Lindy's insight that MDT removes the human element

otherCharacters.name: Lindy
otherCharacters.role: Someone who experienced MDT and chose to reject it
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Fundamentally changed by her MDT experience - now speaks with 'eerie quiet' and 'matter-of-fact chill'; sees clearly what Eddie can't: that MDT is a trap that removes free will and genuine human experience
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: The crucial difference: Lindy used MDT to survive and can walk away from it. She understands its seduction but values being human more. 'You were always smart' - she sees Eddie never needed MDT to be successful, but he could never see that.

scenes.title: Lindy Leaves - Gennady's Extortion

location.primary: W Hotel Room / W Hotel Street / Hotel Lobby / Van Loon's Office
location.description: Lindy breaks up with Eddie, Gennady ambushes him outside demanding pills at gunpoint
location.significance: Eddie loses Lindy and is now being extorted by MDT-enhanced Gennady

mdtTracking.effects: Eddie stoic and calculating on MDT; Gennady addicted and dangerous

plotSummary.brief: Lindy tells Eddie goodbye forever and leaves New York, Gennady confronts Eddie demanding 100 pills at gunpoint, Eddie negotiates to 10 pills, returns to Van Loon
plotSummary.detailed: In the hotel room, Lindy delivers her final verdict: she understands MDT's power ('invincibility in a bottle') but sees the trap - 'Who'd want to be human?' She came to say goodbye and never wants to see Eddie again. She's leaving New York. From the hotel window, Eddie watches Lindy walk away past Gennady, who's waiting outside watching the hotel. Eddie confronts Gennady on the street. Gennady demands more pills at gunpoint, pushing Eddie to a deserted apartment entrance. He demands 100 pills or threatens to feed Eddie's nose to his dog. Eddie says the dealer is dead, he can't get more. Gennady threatens torture 'in stages.' Eddie negotiates down to 10 pills with 'no guarantee there's more.' Gennady accepts for now, pushes Eddie against the wall. Eddie later gives Gennady the envelope with 10 pills in hotel lobby. Eddie narrates: 'Self-pity and MDT were not compatible. One has to go on... Patch up what's left.' Returns to Van Loon's office.

keyDialogue.quote: You're either the smartest person I've ever met, or the best bullshitter.
keyDialogue.speaker: Hank Atwood
keyDialogue.significance: Atwood's suspicion mirrors audience's - how is this possible?

scenes.significance: Major loss: Lindy permanently leaves Eddie. New threat: Gennady now extorting Eddie for ongoing MDT supply with violence.

eddie.state: Abandoned by Lindy, extorted by Gennady, but pushing forward with MDT-fueled stoicism
eddie.transformation: Loses the one person who truly saw him; chooses MDT and power over human connection
eddie.psychologicalState: 'Self-pity and MDT were not compatible' - suppressing emotions to survive; returning to Van Loon shows commitment to the enhanced path despite losing Lindy

otherCharacters.name: Lindy
otherCharacters.role: The one who got away - chose humanity over enhancement
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Final break - 'I don't ever want to see you again. I'm not even going to stay in New York.' Complete rejection of Eddie and MDT world.
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: Her final line about wanting to be human vs. always being right perfectly encapsulates the film's central question. She leaves not just Eddie, but New York itself to escape the temptation.

otherCharacters.name: Gennady
otherCharacters.role: Loan shark turned MDT addict and extortionist
otherCharacters.relationshipDynamics: Now enhanced and more dangerous; knows about Eddie's business life; willing to use extreme violence ('feed your nose to my dog', 'I do to you in stages'); has leverage through ongoing MDT addiction
otherCharacters.characterArcMoment: From business transaction to violent extortion - MDT hasn't made him more civilized, just more effective at being dangerous

scenes.title: Hired by Van Loon - Mastering MDT

location.primary: Van Loon's Office / Conference Room / W Hotel / Lafayette Trading / Tailor Shop
location.description: Montage showing Eddie's integration into Van Loon's world and mastery of MDT usage
location.significance: Eddie learns to control MDT and becomes indispensable to the merger

mdtTracking.effects: No more blackouts with even dosing, eating, and no alcohol

plotSummary.brief: Van Loon hires Eddie officially after his projections cause firings, two-month montage shows Eddie mastering MDT control and becoming key to the Atwood merger
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie returns to Van Loon's office. Van Loon says Eddie pissed him off by being sick at the Regency meeting. Eddie explains he had 105-degree fever, delirium. Van Loon warns no instability at this level. Eddie sent revised projections. Van Loon admits there were firings over Eddie's projections - Eddie caught things Van Loon's team missed. Van Loon needs to fill a position. Eddie is hired. Montage: Two months pass. Eddie helps broker 'the most important merger in corporate history.' In conference room with Van Loon, Pierce, and power players, Eddie sketches elaborate charts - even Pierce looks impressed. At W Hotel eating room service, Eddie takes pills carefully: 'if I maintained an even dose... remembered to eat... drank no alcohol... the blackouts didn't recur.' Back at Lafayette Day Trading. At Madison Avenue tailor getting suits made, Eddie asks for 'imperceptible compartment' to hide pills.

keyDialogue.quote: I know you, Eddie. The real you. And this isn't you.
keyDialogue.speaker: Lindy
keyDialogue.significance: Questions whether Eddie's transformation is authentic

keyDialogue.quote: This IS me. The me I was always supposed to be.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie
keyDialogue.significance: Eddie's justification for drug use

scenes.significance: Eddie achieves professional success, learns to control MDT side effects, becomes integral to Van Loon's operation. Time-passing montage showing adaptation.

eddie.transformation: From chaotic MDT user to disciplined enhancement manager; trading human connection for professional achievement
eddie.psychologicalState: Methodical, controlled, focused on work; has learned the rules of MDT survival (even dose, eat, no alcohol); no mention of Lindy - suppressing that loss

scenes.title: Securing the Supply - Lab Analysis

location.primary: Windowless Room / Eddie's Hotel Bathroom / Laboratory
location.description: Eddie hires security team, shows invisible suit pocket, takes MDT to lab for analysis
location.significance: Eddie trying to solve the supply problem scientifically

mdtTracking.effects: Enhanced research abilities

plotSummary.brief: Eddie hires discrete security team (two beefy men, one with tattoos), shows his invisible suit pocket for MDT, takes pills to lab technician for synthesis attempt
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie in windowless room hiring two professional muscle (one with elaborate finger tattoos) - instructs them to follow 10 steps behind, be completely inconspicuous: 'You're a CEO's wife -- you're wallpaper.' Eddie demonstrates his suit's invisible pocket sewn by tailor. Voiceover: 'I would never again stash my MDT, not in an apartment, not in Fort Knox.' Takes MDT to state-of-the-art lab in after-hours furtive meeting with technician. Analysis shows it's professional synthesis, 'nothing you can cook up on a stove top.' Eddie asks if more can be made. Technician: can combine same ingredients but exact delivery method requires 'clinical trials, guinea pig people' - 12-18 months. Eddie offers $2 million to do it in 6 months. Technician considers, takes the packet back.

keyDialogue.quote: They're all dead. Everyone who posted about MDT... they're all gone.
keyDialogue.speaker: Eddie (V.O.)
keyDialogue.significance: Realization of mortality

scenes.significance: Reveals the full scope of MDT's dangers - it's not just side effects, it's fatal

location.description: Detective confronts Eddie about Donatella Alvarez murder using magazine photo

plotSummary.brief: Detective confronts Eddie at business lunch, witness identified him from magazine photo as Donatella Alvarez murder suspect, Eddie hires Morris Brandt, released for now
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie having lunch with power players. His security men seated at bar. Pan reveals the detective from Vernon's murder also at bar. Eddie casually approaches, pretends to order drink, doesn't make eye contact. 'I thought we straightened this out, Detective.' Detective: 'This isn't about Vernon Gant.' Shows Eddie NY Daily News with his trading floor photo. 'A witness identified the Donatella Alvarez suspect as this person. You want to tell me about your whereabouts on the night of June 12?' Eddie keeps cool, makes excuses to table, leaves with detective. Hires Morris Brandt, best lawyer in NYC. Outside precinct, Brandt: 'You're lucky somebody wiped the room. Weak circumstantial at best. Just between us -- were you there?' Eddie: 'I don't remember.' Brandt shrugs: 'Busy life.'

plotSummary.brief: Eddie presents merger proposal to Hank Atwood, who looks frail and uses a cane, showing visible MDT withdrawal effects
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie presents to Van Loon Associates and Hank Atwood about unified front for Mexican industrial concessions. Eddie explains information can be bought about corrupt governmental bribe structure. Atwood rubs his temples (distracted/in pain) but engages piercingly. Meeting breaks up. Van Loon notices Atwood using a cane: 'Jesus. He seems frail.' Eddie: 'Might be an act.' Van Loon: 'doesn't track. He's not even 60.' Van Loon asks Eddie his take when this is over. Eddie asks his compensation. Van Loon: 'You should have pre-negotiated.' Eddie: 'I trust you.' Van Loon: 'You shouldn't.'

plotSummary.detailed: Hospital room - Hank Atwood dead, nurse covers him with sheet. In waiting room, Tan Coat sits red-eyed. Eddie appears. 'I'm sure you're curious about what's happened to your boss. If my attorney was really working for Mr. Atwood, to save his life, then why is he dead? At what point was the Pony Express supposed to ride in with the life-saving medication? Or, did the Pony decide that he should be running his own Pony show?'

scenes.title: The Pharmaceutical Conspiracy Revealed

location.description: Private meeting with pharmaceutical executive
location.significance: The true creators of MDT reveal themselves

mdtTracking.effects: Cognitive enhancement with physical deterioration

plotSummary.brief: John Steadman from Eiben-Chemcorps reveals they created MDT, improved it (1 pill/week), have been watching Eddie, want to recruit him
plotSummary.detailed: Steadman waits in Eddie's office, unusually relaxed, subtle gleam. Calls him 'Senator Morgan' - prescient authority suggests Eddie will win. 'Everything from here's a technicality.' Says eventually Eddie will run out. Reveals: 'We've gotten most of the bugs out. It's longer lasting - you'll only have to take one a week.' They've been watching MDT users, Eddie went furthest fastest. Vernon was 'security breach' they 'took care of.' Won't be on street again. They want Eddie to keep doing what he's doing, they won't bother him much 'at first.' Later they have 'grandiose' ideas. If Eddie refuses: 'your candle will have shed a brief, but lovely, light.' They shut down Eddie's lab. Eddie: 'Which one?' Steadman: 'All of them.' Eddie: 'You sure?'

keyDialogue.quote: Your body is shutting down. Whatever you're taking, stop immediately.
keyDialogue.speaker: Doctor
keyDialogue.significance: Medical confirmation of fatal trajectory

scenes.significance: Makes Eddie's mortality concrete - he will die if he continues

scenes.title: Eddie's Defiance - 'Fifty Steps Ahead'

location.description: Confrontation outside where Eddie refuses to be controlled
location.significance: Eddie asserts independence, reveals he's outmaneuvered them

mdtTracking.effects: Withdrawal symptoms but clear mind

plotSummary.brief: Eddie asks if he killed the woman (Steadman won't say), refuses to get in Steadman's limo, reveals he's created defense structure and synthesized MDT himself
plotSummary.detailed: Eddie asks: 'Did I kill that woman?' Steadman: 'Do you really want to know?' Eddie thinks - no. Outside, Steadman philosophizes about compromise on path to greatness. At limo, Eddie won't get in. Steadman enters first. Eddie closes door, stays outside. 'Don't underestimate your own creation. It puts me 50 steps ahead of you fucks. You think I didn't spend my days on MDT devising a personal defense structure that would scare the shit out of the Israelis? You think there's not people with a bead on you right now, right in this building?' Steadman: 'You'll run out. You'll die.' Eddie: 'Or I'll think of something. Isn't that what MDT does? What if I just ask the drug... how to fuck itself? I mean, isn't it like the 8-ball? It always answers.' Limo pulls away. Eddie exhales. Only then do we see: He's scared. THE END.

keyDialogue.quote: You were dying inside, so you took a pill. And now you're dying outside too.

keyDialogue.significance: Sums up Eddie's journey and tragedy
